gao.dbmanager

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gao.dbmanager.DBManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDBManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HsqlDBManager, MsSqlDBManager, MySqlDBManager, OracleDBManager, PostgresDBManager

    public class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDBManager
    DBManagers are needed to perform any database-related operation for implementations of IGeoObjects. For some databases it may be necessary to use a derived DBManager.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Martin Beyer, Marcus Kerschner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.sql.Connection connection 
      protected DBParameters dbParameters 
      protected java.lang.Integer errorCodeTableExists
      Error-code which is contained in the SQLException when a create-table statement tries to create a table which already exists.
      protected org.apache.ws.jaxme.sqls.SQLGenerator generator
      SQLGenerator
      protected java.lang.String schemaname
      Name of the database-schema this DBManager-instance works with
      protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,TableDefinition> tables
      Stores the TableDefinitions by their names.

                                        java.lang.Class<T> pGeoObjectClass)
                   throws DBManagerException
        Adds GAO-columns to an already existing table and registers the specified class to the table.
        Type Parameters:
        T - IGeoObject
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the existing table.
        pGeoObjectClass - Class of the IGeoObjects that will be stored in the new table.

        DBManagerException

      • addRelation

        public <T extends IGeoObject> void addRelation(java.lang.String tableName,
                                      TableDefinition tableDef,
                                      java.lang.Class<T> pGeoObjectClass)
                 throws DBManagerException
        Adds a new relation (table) to the database. The also given class is registered. If there is already a table with the same name in this database it is assumed that the table already exists.
        Specified by:
        addRelation in interface IDBManager
        Parameters:
        pRelationName - Name of the relation (table)
        pTableDef - TableDefinition of table to add
        pGeoObjectClass - Class of the GeoObject (implements IGeoObject) which should be stored in the new table
        Throws:
        DBManagerException

      • getNewConnection

        public final java.sql.Connection getNewConnection()
                                           throws DBManagerException
        Getter for a new connection to the database.
        NOTE: If u don't need the connection anymore, close it to release resources. If you don't, it's likely that a connection limit might cause unexpected errors.
        Returns:
        a new Connection
        Throws:
        DBManagerException

      • replaceObjectInRelation

                                                  T pGeoObject)
                             throws DBManagerException
        replaces an existing GeoObject in a relation (table) by a new one. The new GeoObject has to have the same ID as the old one.
        Specified by:
        replaceObjectInRelation in interface IDBManager
        Parameters:
        pRelationName - relationName name of the relation (table)
        pGeoObject - GeoObject to replace
        Throws:
        DBManagerException

      • search

        public <T extends IGeoObject> Search<T> search(SearchType pSearchType,
                                      GeoData pGeoData,
                                      org.apache.ws.jaxme.sqls.SelectStatement pStmt)
                                    throws SearchException,
                                           DBManagerException
        Description copied from interface: IDBManager
        Searches the database for IGeoObjects in the specified way.
        Specified by:
        search in interface IDBManager
        Parameters:
        pSearchType - SearchType
        pGeoData - GeoData used as the spatial condition of the query
        pStmt - SelectStatement
        Returns:
        gao.core.Search object than can be used to retrieve IGeoObjects
        Throws:
        SearchException
        DBManagerException

      • search

        public <T extends IGeoObject> Search<T> search(SearchType pSearchType,
                                      GeoData pGeoData,
                                      org.apache.ws.jaxme.sqls.SelectStatement pStmt,
                                      double minArea)
                                    throws SearchException,
                                           DBManagerException
        Convenience method. If u don't want to specify a minimum area, use the corresponding method without the minArea parameter.
        Parameters:
        minArea - Non-spatial constraint used in the query
        Throws:
        SearchException
        DBManagerException
        See Also:
        IDBManager.search(SearchType, GeoData, SelectStatement)

      • search

        public <T extends IGeoObject> java.util.Vector<T> search(SearchType pSearchType,
                                                GeoData pGeoData,
                                                org.apache.ws.jaxme.sqls.SelectStatement pStmt,
                                                int pMaxCandidates)
                                              throws SearchException,
                                                     DBManagerException
        Deprecated. Preferrably use the new search
        Searches the database for GeoObjects. Any search which is more complicated than the search for a GeoObject which is identified by its ID is located here.
        Specified by:
        search in interface IDBManager
        Parameters:
        pSearchType - Search-Type, defined in SearchType
        pGeoData - GeoData as "geo-condition" of the query
        pStmt - SelectStatement for any other (non-geo) conditions
        pMaxCandidates - number of candidates which should maximal be searched
        Returns:
        Iterable collection of IGeoObject-implementations
        Throws:
        DBManagerException
        GeoDataException
        SearchException
        See Also:
        IDBManager.search(SearchType, GeoData, SelectStatement, int)
